title: Espn Africa's Electrifying Schedule Of High-octane Sports Showdowns
body:
Major League Cricket, 30 for 30 Sports documentaries and more

European Football Season kicks off in August

Johannesburg, 1 July 2024: ESPN Africa is set to warm up the mid-year Winter viewing with a thrilling line-up of non-stop action from American leagues and brand-new sports documentaries. From basketball to American football and now even cricket, ESPN has sports fans across the continent covered, including DStv Access Subscribers, following ESPN’s expansion to the tier last year.

Cricket fans are in for a treat as, from Friday, July 5, ESPN will be the home of the American Major League Cricket, the US domestic Twenty20 cricket league. The league starts with MI New York v Seattle Orcas, live on July 5 at 21:30 (CAT), and is set to bowl audiences over with three games per week, leading up to the finals at the end of the month.

A slate of all-new programming from ESPN Films’ Peabody and Academy Award®-winning 30 for 30 series will premiere across Africa this month, providing unprecedented access to some of the most compelling stories in sports. First up, 30 for 30 False Positive will premiere on Wednesday, July 3, at 20:00, looking into the life of former track and field superstar Butch Reynolds and his relentless battle to clear his name following drug accusations, revealing systemic flaws within sports governance and the enduring impact of false accusations on an athlete’s legacy. 30 for 30: I’m Just Here for the Riot, which premieres on Wednesday, July 10 at 19:00, chronicles the aftermath of the Canucks’ Stanley Cup Finals loss to the Boston Bruins, raising deeper questions about fandom, violence, and the shocking power of an angry crowd.

30 for 30 No Scope: The Story of FaZe Clan premieres on Sunday, July 21, at 19:00 and gives a wide-ranging, eye-opening, and unsparing look at the popular e-sports team, and the remarkable series of ups and downs that have defined the individual gamers. 30 for 30 Dude Perfect: A Very Long Shot traces the meteoric rise of a group of friends from College Station, Texas, whose backyard antics evolved into a global sports-comedy phenomenon, on Wednesday, August 7 at 20:00.

Tennis fans can look forward to the 8-part documentary In the Arena: Serena Williams, which is set to premiere on ESPN on Friday, July 21, at 20:00. Williams dominated tennis for over two decades, winning 23 Grand Slams (singles) and changing the sport forever. This series will provide the most complete, intimate, and compelling account of her legendary career, featuring firsthand perspective from Serena and key figures throughout her life, on Tuesday evenings with one premiere episode per week for eight weeks. Also, on Wednesday, July 31 July at 20:00, 30 for 30 American Son captures a pivotal moment in sports history, chronicling the remarkable journey of Michael Chang, the tennis prodigy whose ascent to fame coincided with an unfathomable and unforgettable upset of Ivan Lendl at the 1989 French Open.

Basketball fans can settle in for a series of showdowns as the American Olympic Basketball (USAB) team leads up to the Paris Olympics. Mark your calendar for these exciting fixtures:

From Monday, July 29, at 20:30, the series Sports Woman will premiere with one new episode each week. Showcasing inspiring stories of female athletes across all sports and cultures, this remarkable series recognises the elite, the inspiring and the diverse, through the untold motivational stories of endurance, and overcoming challenges and adversity. Additionally, starting August 5, ESPN will broadcast the 26-part series, The Rising. This timeless series recognises the importance of the many courageous acts that have brought about change, in sport and well beyond.

Soccer fans across the continent will be delighted to see the new European football season kick off this August. Viewers can expect a record number of leagues on ESPN this season, including the EFL (English Football League), Dutch Eredivise, the Scottish Premiership, the Belgian Pro League, the German DFB Cup and continue to enjoy the NWSL (National Woman’s Soccer League)

And, as the weather warms, fans can look forward to the start of the NFL (National Football League) season on Friday, September 6, and the NBA (National Basketball Association) regular season on Tuesday, October 22.

title: Fakhar, Haris, Amir and others get NOC for foreign leagues
body:
LAHORE (Web Desk) – The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has issued no-objection certificates (NOC) to Fakhar Zaman, Haris Rauf, Mohammad Amir and other players to participate in cricket leagues.

The development comes days after Pakistan players reached back from West Indies as they faced early elimination from the T20 World Cup 2024.

The board has issued NOCs to the following cricketers:

Abrar Ahmed – Major League Cricket – 4 to 28 July

Fakhar Zaman – Caribbean Premier League – 29 August to 6 October

Haris Rauf – Major League Cricket – 5 to 28 July

Mohammad Amir – County Cricket – 4 to 20 July

Mohammad Haris – Lanka Premier League – 1 to 21 July

Mohammad Hasnain – Lanka Premier League – 1 to 21 July

Salman Ali Agha – Lanka Premier League – 1 to 21 July

Shadab Khan – Lanka Premier League – 1 to 21 July

Sharjeel Khan – World Championship of Legends – 3 to 13 July

Sohaib Maqsood – World Championship of Legends – 3 to 13 July

Usama Mir – The Hundred – 23 July to 20 August

title: 12 players including Amir, Shadab get PCB's nod for league cricket
body:
The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) on Tuesday issued no-objection certificates (NOCs) to 12 players who will participate in league cricket in United States’ Major League Cricket (MLC), Sri Lanka’s Lanka Premier League (LPL), and others.

Some of the players from the list are part of Pakistan’s central contract while the others have not played for the Green Shirts in a long time.

Mystery spinner Abrar Ahmed, and pacers Zaman Khan and Haris Rauf will be in action in the Major League Cricket (MLC) which is set to begin on July 5 in the United States.

Mohammad Haris, Salman Ali Agha, Shadab Khan and Mohammad Hasnain (non-centrally contracted) will be seen in action in the Lanka Premier League (LPL) which is currently underway in Sri Lanka.

Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood, who have not played for Pakistan in a long time will participate in the World Championship of Legends from July 3 to 13.

Left-arm pacer Mohammad Amir will play County Cricket from July 4 to 20, explosive batter Fakhar Zaman will be in action in the Caribbean Premier League (CPL) from August 29 to October 6 while wrist spinner Usama Mir will feature in England’s The Hundred from July 23 to August 20.

It is worth mentioning that the PCB has a policy where centrally contracted players cannot play more than two leagues. Due to that reason, wicketkeeper batter Azam Khan withdrew from LPL as he could not get NOC from the board.

Azam was part of LPL side B-Love Kandy who will begin their campaign against Colombo Strikers on Tuesday.

Saim Ayub and Azam are also part of Guyana Warriors for the upcoming CPL 2024 but both are yet to obtain NOC from the PCB.

List of Pakistani players to get NOCs

Abrar Ahmed – Major League Cricket

Fakhar Zaman – Caribbean Premier League

Haris Rauf – Major League Cricket

Mohammad Amir – County Cricket

Mohammad Haris – Lanka Premier League

Mohammad Hasnain – Lanka Premier League

Salman Ali Agha – Lanka Premier League

Shadab Khan – Lanka Premier League

Sharjeel Khan – World Championship of Legends

Sohaib Maqsood – World Championship of Legends

Usama Mir – The Hundred

Zaman Khan – Major League Cricket

title: Seattle Orcas signs Zaman Khan for second edition of Major League Cricket
body:
Seattle Orcas have made a splash in the cricket world by signing Zaman Khan, Pakistan’s rising star in fast bowling, for the upcoming second edition of the Major League Cricket.

Known for his blistering pace and distinctive slingy action, Zaman promises to inject new dynamism into the Orcas' bowling attack, setting the stage for thrilling encounters and formidable challenges.

The right-arm pacer has swiftly risen through the ranks internationally, gaining recognition for his unique right-handed bowling style reminiscent of Sri Lankan legend Lasith Malinga.

Debuting in T20 Internationals in March 2023 against Afghanistan, Khan quickly made an impact with his speed and precision. His consistent performances earned him a spot in Pakistan’s squad for the 2023 Asia Cup, where he showcased his adaptability by debuting in One-Day Internationals as a replacement player.

Besides Zaman, Pakistan all-rounder Imad Wasim, and pacer Haris Rauf will also participate in the upcoming tournament for their respective teams. Imad will feature for the Seattle Orcas, while Haris will represent the San Francisco Unicorns.

The second season of USA’s Major League Cricket (MLC) kicks off on July 5, just a week after the ICC T20 World Cup 2024, and cricket fans are buzzing with anticipation.

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Here are the confirmed squads and schedule
body:
Six teams will be in action in Major League Cricket 2024, scheduled to be held in the USA’s Texas and North Carolina from 5th to 28th July.

MLC will hold its second edition after the inaugural edition took place last year.

MI New York are the defending champions. They defeated Seattle Orcas in the MLC 2023 final to claim the first Major League Cricket title.

The MLC 2024 season opener will see a rematch of last year’s final as MI New York take on Seattle Orcas once again at Church Street Park in North Carolina.

Later on the same day, Texas Super Kings will host the LA Knight Riders at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.

The six teams will compete in 21 matches in a round-robin league format. The initial 15 matches will be split between the two venues - Church Street Park and Grand Prairie Stadium. However, the final six group matches and the knockout fixtures will all be held at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas.

The teams will face each other once in the league phase, after which the top four sides will progress to the playoffs. The MLC 2024 final will take place at the Grand Prairie Stadium on 29th July.

Four of the six MLC teams are owned by franchises of the Indian Premier League (IPL). These include MI New York (Mumbai Indians), Texas Super Kings (Chennai Super Kings), LA Knight Riders (Kolkata Knight Riders), and the Seattle Orcas (Delhi Capitals). The other two teams are San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom.

All six teams will feature some top international cricketers in their squads for MLC 2024. MI New York boast former West Indian captain Kieron Pollard in their roster, while South African duo Wayne Parnell and Quinton de Kock will represent Seattle Orcas.

The Texas Super Kings squad is led by South African star Faf du Plessis, while West Indian off-spinner Sunil Narine will lead the LA Knight Riders.

Washington Freedom, coached by Ricky Ponting, boasts a strong Australian contingent with Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Travis Head in their ranks. New Zealand batter Finn Allen has joined the San Francisco Unicorns.

title: Haris Rauf, Fakhar Zaman among Pakistan players to get NOC from PCB for T20 leagues
body:
Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has officially confirmed providing No Objection Certificate (NOC) to 12 of their players for different T20 leagues and County Championship. Mohammad Amir is the only player among them to turn up in County Championship for Derbyshire from July 4 to 20. As many as three players will play in the second edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) from July 4 to July 28.

Abrar Ahmed, Haris Rauf and Zaman Khan will be featuring in MLC that is set to commence on July 5 and will conclude on July 28. Interestingly, there is a mention of Amir playing in County Championship but not of Imad Wasim featuring for Seattle Orcas in the PCB press release. Both players took back their international retirement for the recently concluded T20 World Cup but Pakistan got knocked out in the group stage and it is still not clear if they will continue playing for the country.

The fifth edition of the Lanka Premier League (LPL) got underway on July 1 (Monday) and four more players from the country will feature in the tournament. Mohammad Haris, Shadab Khan, Salman Ali Agha and Mohammad Hasnain (not centrally contracted) will turn for different teams in the tournament.

Two players who are not in the scheme of things for Pakistan - Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood - have also been granted permission to play in the World Championship of Legends, the tournament in which mostly retired players like Yuvraj Singh and Chris Gayle among many other stars are taking part.

Another Pakistan star Fakhar Zaman has got the NOC from the board to feature in the Caribbean Premier League (CPL) that is to be played from August 29 to October 6. He is set to play for new franchise Antigua and Barbuda Falcons. Imad Wasim and Amir are also set to play for the same team but again, there is no mention of them getting NOC for the same. For the unversed, PCB allows its centrally contracted players to feature in only two T20 leagues apart from Pakistan Super League (PSL).

List of Pakistan players to get NOC from PCB:

Abrar Ahmed – Major League Cricket – 4 to 28 July

title: [Watch] Jason Roy Back In Knight Riders Family; Swings Hard Ahead Of MLC 2024
body:
Jason Roy in action ahead of MLC 2024 (X.com)

Jason Roy opted himself out of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, in which Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) won the title after 10 long years under the leadership of Shreyas Iyer and mentor Gautam Gambhir.

Of course, Roy's replacement Phil Salt played a crucial role in order to make it happen. However, KKR dearly missed Roy before Salt's carnage began, as he set the stage on fire in the previous edition.

As Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 is set to get underway on July 6, Roy, who has also been signed by Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR), has seen back in Purple and Gold colours. In fact, he had a little candid conversation with the camera person before taking the centre stage by swinging hard.

Watch - Jason Roy Practices Hard Ahead Of MLC 2024

Roy, 33 now, played only three matches for LAKR last year, in which he aggregated 54 runs at a strike rate of 150. He smashed five fours and four sixes, and will be looking to improve his numbers this time around.

LAKR will begin the MLC 2024 campaign by going up against Texas Super Kings on July 6.

title: I don't have any plan for myself at this moment: Shakib
body:
DHAKA, July 2, 2024 (BSS) - Ace allrounder Shakib Al Hasan said he wants to focus solely on cricket at this moment, rather than thinking about the future of his career.

"I don't have any plan for myself at this moment. I have two T20 tournaments ahead of me--an MLC (Major League Cricket) organized by USA and the next is Canada's Global T20. I will play those two tournaments and see how it is going. After that, there is a Test series against Pakistan and I will play that series. That's the plan for now," Shakib said here today as he was leaving the country for USA to play MLC.

Shakib had below par T20 World Cup campaign this year, which encouraged his critics to lash out at him vehemently. They raised their voice high about his immediate retirement, citing the reason that at the age of 37, it would be tough for the allrounder to regain his form.

Earlier, Shakib revealed that he would retire from the cricket after the Champions Trophy in 2025 but recently in an interview with the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) he revealed that he wants to play another ODI World Cup which is in 2027.

But it looked he changed his plan again.

"I didn't really plan too much. I need to understand my physical condition. At this moment it is not possible for me to plan for the next three or four years. I think it's better to plan for three or six months. For the time being, my plan is for Pakistan series, then I will see what next for me," Shakib added.

Bangladesh won three matches of the group phase in T20 World Cup and moved up to the Supe 8 for only the second time in tournament's history. However they lost all three matches in Super 8 phase and even though they had the golden chance to make it semifinal, Bangladesh's safe cricket sank them at the end.

"May be we didn't play all out cricket. We didn't get the kind of results we expected or the kind of results we had a chance of getting. We fulfilled the initial (Super Eight) target, so it is successful from that point of view. It's a bit disappointing for us because we couldn't go to the semifinal."

In response to a query why they couldn't make it possible to make it semis, Shakib said, 'It is difficult to say. In fact, I am sure those who are there will decide that why we can't make it. The coach, captain, team and others who are in the cricket operations, board and others will discuss together to sort it out."

title: PCB grants noc to 12 cricketers for global league participation
body:
The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has granted no-objection certificates (NOCs) to 12 cricketers, allowing them to participate in various international leagues and tournaments.

This decision enables players to showcase their talents globally while adhering to PCB's policies.

Mystery spinner Abrar Ahmed will compete in Major League Cricket from July 4 to July 28, while Fakhar Zaman will join the Caribbean Premier League, spanning from August 29 to October 6.

Pacer Haris Rauf is set to play in Major League Cricket from July 5 to July 28, and Mohammad Amir will represent County Cricket from July 4 to July 20.

Additionally, Mohammad Haris, Mohammad Hasnain (a non-centrally contracted player), Salman Ali Agha, and Shadab Khan will all participate in the Lanka Premier League from July 1 to July 21.

Sharjeel Khan and Sohaib Maqsood are slated for the World Championship of Legends, scheduled from July 3 to July 13.

Usama Mir will compete in The Hundred, scheduled from July 23 to August 20, and Zaman Khan will join Major League Cricket from July 4 to July 28.

However, Pakistan's wicketkeeper-batsman Azam Khan and opening batsman Saim Ayub could not obtain NOCs as they are part of the Guyana Warriors for the upcoming CPL 2024.

Azam also recently opted out of the Lanka Premier League (LPL) in adherence to the PCB's policy of granting NOCs to players for participation in a maximum of two leagues annually.

title: 'I don't have many plans' - Shakib Al Hasan yet to decide on India tour participation
body:
Shakib Al Hasan said he will decide on his participation in Bangladesh's upcoming tour of India only after completing his commitments in Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 and Global T20 League Canada 2024. Bangladesh are scheduled to play two Tests and three T20Is against India from September 19 to October 12 following their tour of Pakistan in August, where they are slated to play a two-match Test series.

The legendary all-rounder departed from Dhaka to the USA on Monday, July 1, to take part in the second edition of MLC. He will be plying his trade for Los Angeles Knight Riders, who finished last in the inaugural season last year. Shakib informed that he isn't thinking too far ahead, having only planned till the tour of Pakistan next month.

“I don't have many plans. There are two T20 tournaments in front of me one is MLC and the other one is the Global T20 League in Canada and let me see where I stand after playing these two tournaments because I need to understand [how I feel],” Shakib was quoted as saying by Cricbuzz.

“There is international cricket and there is a series against Pakistan, and I am planning till that point of time and not planning beyond that. Now I don't have time to plan for three-four years and so planning for three to six months is better and later will think about my next plan and so till now I am planning till the Pakistan series,” the experienced cricketer added.

Also Read: Warner, Babar, Narine, Shakib among galaxy of stars to light up GT20 Canada 2024

Taskin Ahmed apologized for missing the team bus: Shakib

Taskin Ahmed was surprisingly left out of the playing XI in Bangladesh's crucial Super Eights fixture in the recently concluded T20 World Cup 2024 against eventual champions India in Antigua. A Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) official had recently revealed that the pacer woke up late in the morning and missed the team bus. Shakib also spoke along those lines and said that the 29-year-old apologized for his negligence.

“The team bus starts at a certain point and there is a rule for cricketers that team bus does not stop for anyone and if anyone misses it in that case he comes in the next car. The manager's car or a taxi is there and the support of transport was difficult in the West Indies. When Taskin arrived it was five to 10 minutes before the toss, and certainly it was difficult to pick him at that point in the team and it was difficult for him as well,” Shakib said.

Also Read: T20 World Cup 2024: Taskin Ahmed apologises for missing team bus after waking up late for India game

“Taskin apologized to the team for that afterwards and everyone in the team took it normally because a man can mistake and anyone can commit unintentional mistake, and he accepted it and the thing ended at that point of time,” the cricketer said.

title: 12 cricketers get NoC from PCB to play abroad

title: Major League Cricket 2024: Date, Schedule, Teams, Live Streaming, and More
body:
After a successful season in 2023, the Major League Cricket returns with its second edition. The MLC 2024 will be played from July 5, with the final scheduled for July 28. The Major League Cricket rose to fame after four IPL franchises, namely Mumbai Indians, Chennai Super Kings, Kolkata Knight Riders and Delhi Capitals confirmed owning four of the six teams in the league.

The tournament opener will see a repeat of the 2023 finale where defending champions, MI New York will take on Seattle Orcas at the Church Street Park on July 6 (IST). Furthermore, the 2024 edition will see inclusion of several star players, including the likes of Pat Cummins, Andre Russell, David Miller, Faf du Plessis, Glenn maxwell, Nicholas Pooran, Quinton de Kock among others.

Here in this article, we’ll take you through all the relevant details around Major League Cricket 2024 (MLC 2024).

When and where will MLC 2024 take place?

As part of the agreement, T10 Sports has been appointed as the unit’s official kit & merchandise partner, while Masuri has become the official supplier of the squad for the MLC 2024.

Masuri is a growing sports goods company that specialises in developing and manufacturing industry-leading safety equipment. The corporation, headquartered in Winchester, is well-known in several worldwide markets, including the United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, South Africa, and India.

title: All you need to know about the MLC Season 2
body:
Major League Cricket is returning with its second season after the grand success and launch of the league during its inaugural run in 2023. The 2024 season starts July 5, with the Championship Final taking place at Grand Prairie Stadium on July 28. Here’s your guide to the upcoming exciting season of the MLC in the USA.

How many teams are going to participate?

Just like the inaugural season, the second season of the MLC will see all the six founding teams clashing against each other with the Seattle Orcas, MI New York, LA Knight Riders, Washington Freedom, San Francisco Unicorns and Texas Super Kings battling it out

Where is it going to be played?

After the success that was the first season, the league will be played across the two venues which also hosted the matches last year - Grand Prairie Stadium in Texas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

Has the format changed?

Yes. The league's first season was played in a single round robin format with 15 league stages matches. However, the second season will see an increase to 21 league games, with each of the teams playing seven games instead of five last season. The tournament will then move to the playoff stages, which will follow the same format as the first season with a Qualifier, Challenger and Eliminator to be played before the summit clash.

MLC has been given List A status. What does that mean?

Earlier this year, the ICC awarded the MLC with List A status, making it only the second Associate-run franchise competition to acquire the status from the game’s governing body. This basically means all the records, runs, wickets and stats acquired in the MLC will now be added to the official records of the format. It also means that MLC is now an official T20 League, much like the IPL or the SA20 or Big Bash League.

How long are the games?

The T20 format is a shortened version of cricket that lasts approx 3- 3 ½ hours.

Where can we watch MLC?

To cheer on your Seattle Orcas in person, all matches will be broadcast at all 5 locations at Flat Stick Pub (https://flatstickpub.com/locations/). For more info check out our watch party events on Facebook.

title: San Francisco Unicorns partners with Bay area Cadillac group
body:
Local Bay Area Cadillac dealership group named as Official Luxury Vehicle of the San Francisco Unicorns for the 2024 Major League Cricket (MLC) season.

Partnership will see dealership’s branding displayed on the back of the Unicorns’ playing jerseys throughout the tournament.

The second season of MLC will begin on July 5, with the first of the Unicorns’ seven regular-season matches taking place on July 7. Tickets for all matches are available now at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com.

The San Francisco Unicorns has announced local Bay Area dealership group, consisting of Dublin Cadillac, Fremont Cadillac and Stevens Creek Cadillac as its Official Luxury Vehicle partner for the imminent Major League Cricket season.

The agreement sees the famed Cadillac logo displayed on the back of the Unicorns’ player jersey for the duration of the MLC season, set to be played at the Grand Prairie Stadium near Dallas, TX, and the Church Street Park in Morrisville, NC, throughout July.

The Cadillac dealership is a prominent seller of luxury new and used vehicles around the Bay Area, and is currently run by its CEO, founder and automotive entrepreneur Inder Dosanjh.

Inder Dosanjh, CEO and Founder of California Automotive Retailing Group, said: “San Francisco Unicorns continue to make waves among a growing community of cricket fans in the Bay Area, many of whom are regulars across our Cadillac dealerships, and we’re thrilled to partner them towards success in this year’s MLC.

“They’re commitment to excellence both on and off the pitch chimes with our own and Cadillac’s path to success, and our local team are excited to have global superstars like Pat Cummins displaying the logo throughout the event.”

David White, General Manager of San Francisco Unicorns, added: “Our Bay Area footprint is key to our sustainable, ambitious vision to grow cricket and support for the Unicorns over time, and this group partnership with one of the most recognizable dealerships in the area cements this.

“We’ll be proud to display the Dosanjh Family Auto Group and the Cadillac logo around our MLC matches this season, and we hope that those watching back in San Francisco and its surrounds will appreciate the home connection with one of its much-loved institutions.”

The Unicorns’ 2024 roster features Australia captain Pat Cummins, explosive batters Finn Allen and Matt Short, recent USA T20 World Cup hero and club captain Corey Anderson, and express bowler Haris Rauf. For the second successive season, the Unicorns will be coached by two-time Indian Premier League (IPL) Player of the Season Shane Watson.

body:
Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) is thrilled to announce that luxury automotive brand Lexus has become the Automotive Partner for the league’s highly anticipated second season.

“We are excited to welcome Lexus as the Automotive Partner of Major League Cricket,” said Vijay Srinivasan, CEO of MLC. “Their reputation for unparalleled luxury and commitment to their customers aligns perfectly with our vision for the league. Together, we look forward to delivering an exceptional experience to cricket fans across the nation.”

Under the new agreement, Lexus will be integrated into on-field and broadcast content throughout the season. The brand will also be featured in fan communications and MLC digital platforms. This is the first time Lexus and MLC have partnered together.

“Partnering with Major League Cricket offers Lexus the opportunity to reach a new diverse fanbase with a brand that shares an unwavering commitment to performance, customer experience, and their fans,” said David Telfer, Head of Lexus Advertising & Media. “We’re committed to growing with MLC during its second season to elevate the presence of the U.S. team and engage with new fans.”

MLC kicks off its second season on Friday, July 5. Tickets for all matches, including the four playoffs, are available online through the Official Cognizant Major League Cricket website. In addition to the world-class matches, fans have several ticket options to choose from, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person. The season’s excitement extends beyond the pitch, with entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament.

Fans nationwide are encouraged to act fast and secure tickets at tickets.majorleaguecricket.com .

title: MLC 2024 Live Streaming: How to watch Major League Cricket
body:
MLC 2024 Live Streaming: The second edition of the Major League Cricket will be played between July 5 and 28 in the United States. As per the MLC 2024 schedule, the first match will be played between defending champions MI New York and Seattle Orcas on July 5 in Church Street Park, Morrisville.

Major League Cricket 2024 will consist of a total of 25 matches which will be played between six participants.

MLC 2024 will follow round robin and playoffs format where the top 4 teams of the points table will advance to the playoffs round.

As of last season, the entire tournament will be hosted at two venues – Grand Prairie Stadium in Grand Prairie, Texas and Church Street Park in Morrisville, North Carolina.

MLC 2024 Live Streaming

Willow by Cricbuzz is the official broadcaster of MLC in the USA and Canada. Due to the rise in interest in MLC, the officials have confirmed this season will be live-streamed in Pakistan, Australia, New Zealand, the Middle East, Africa, the United Kingdom, and Ireland.

MLC 2024 broadcaster details for various locations are given below:

Location Broadcaster USA Willow by Cricbuzz, YES Network Canada Willow by Cricbuzz Australia Prime Video New Zealand Prime Video Middle East Cricbuzz North Africa Cricbuzz Pakistan A Sports Sub-Saharan Africa ESPN UK and Ireland TNT Sports India To be announced Caribbean To be announced

How to Watch MLC 2024 Live Streaming in USA?

Willow by Cricbuzz is the official broadcaster of MLC in the USA and Canada. The Willow Premium Subscription is available for USD $9.99/month and there is no free trial period associated with Willow Premium Subscription. Willow Cricket Canada cricket viewers can subscribe at $7.99 CAD/month.

In a new partnership deal to increase viewership and accessibility in the US market, select MLC matches will air across multiple regional sports networks (RSNs), starting with YES Network.

Each RSN will carry all regular season matches of its home MLC team to bring cricket to a wider sports market and drum up more local support within the teams’ hometowns.

The channel is available on most Satellite and Cable Networks for a simple monthly subscription fee or as part of Sports Packages or South Asian packages.

Sling TV Willow Pack

The Sling Willow TV Subscription includes a Willow TV (HD) + Willow Xtra package for live TV coverage for USD 7 for the first month while after the 1st month, the cost will be USD 10/mo.

If you sign up for Sling TV Willow Subscription for a year, it is USD 60, which comes out to USD 5/mo.

Cricket fans can watch live cricket streaming on 3 devices at the same time while you will get 50 cloud DVR storage and access to watch on-demand live cricket for up to 8 days.

Sling Willow TV Subscription comes with South Asian packages including both Willow HD + Willow Extra in the subscription plan. Sling Willow HD will be available for $7/Monthly or $60/Yearly.

Dish TV Package

For Dish TV users, Willow TV subscription will come under the Add-on category. The Dish TV Offers 3 types of Subscription package for its users. Before watching Willow tv you need the subscription add-Ons pack of the following packages on Dish TV.

America’s Top 120 ($79.99/mo) [190 Channels]

America’s Top 200 ($99.99/mo) [240+ Channels]

America’s Top 250 ($109.99/mo) [290+ Channels]

Post choosing a base package, viewers have to select the “Willow HD and Willow Xtra” in the addon category to watch the cricket matches.

Add-on Packages & Channels – Sports > Willow HD and Willow Xtra at USD $14.99/mo

Spectrum TV Package

Willow tv Spectrum is available with its International TV Package of South Asia Channel in Hindi like Willow TV, Sony Asia, TV Asia, SET Asian, ABP News, and Eros Now.

For the users, Spectrum has Willow TV with its Add-On Channel. Get the TV Package or Spectrum Cable TV subscription and watch live cricket match online. Spectrum TV Select provides 125+ Channels at a cost USD $59.99/Month for 12 months.

Century Link TV Subscription

Century Link provides Willow TV Channels for its fans to enjoy the live action of the cricket. Willow Xtra will be available at 668 while Willow HD will be available on channel 1668.

Get here Willow TV Package

Verizon FiOS Subscribe

Verizon FiOS users can watch the live cricket actions on Willow HD cricket which will be available on channel no 806. Users have to subscribe to the “FiOS Hindi Plus” package which costs $34/mo to get access to Willow TV HD. Along with Willow TV, users can also enjoy Aapka Colors, Sony, TV Asia, and Zee TV in this package.

How to Watch MLC 2024 Live Streaming in UK?

TNT Sports holds the official broadcasting rights of Major League 2024 in the United Kingdom(UK). TNT Sports subscriptions cost start from £20 a month and will differ from package to package.

Viewers can subscribe to TNT Sports through Discovery+, BT, EE, Sky and Virgin Media through various subscription costs.

BT Broadband customers can buy the Big Sport package, comprising NOW Sports, all the TNT Sports channels, all the Sky Sports channels, Eurosport and Discovery+, for £45 a month with no upfront fee on a 24-month contract.

How to Watch MLC 2024 Live Streaming in Australia and New Zealand?

Prime Video holds the official broadcasting rights of Major League 2024 in Australia and New Zealand. Prime Video will be available in two different price ranges in both countries. Prime Monthly plan for $9.99/month and Prime Yearly plan for $79/year.

title: San Francisco Unicorns vs. Seattle Orcas
body:
Get your tickets now for the second season of Major League Cricket – America’s first professional T20 Cricket League! See the superstars of cricket from around the world up close as the SF Unicorns take on the Seattle Orcas.

Cricket is a sport for hardcore fans and newbies of all ages, so load up the car and enjoy an afternoon full of world class, high octane action with family and friends 🙌. If you're new to the sport, we'll have Cricket 101 flyers to explain how the game is played!

Gates open 75 minutes before the match starts and parking is available offsite with a free shuttle to the venue. Other questions? Check out our FAQ page (opens in a new tab)for more!

Please note that the entire venue will be fenced off, so you must purchase a ticket in order to gain entry.

title: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024: Schedule, Squads, Venues, and Points Table
body:
The cricketing world is buzzing with anticipation as the second edition of Major League Cricket (MLC) is set to kick off. Running from July 5 to July 28, 2024, MLC 2024 promises to be a spectacular showcase of talent and excitement, bringing together cricket superstars from around the globe to compete in the United States. With matches featuring international icons like Pat Cummins, Andre Russell, David Miller, and many others, this tournament is set to light up stadiums across the country.

The tournament begins on July 5 and runs until the grand finale on July 28. The opening game features MI New York taking on the Seattle Orcas, setting the stage for a thrilling competition.

The matches will be played at 12:30 AM, 1:00 AM, and 6:00 AM Indian Standard Time (IST), accommodating cricket fans worldwide. The tournament will see 21 matches in the group stage, followed by an Eliminator, Qualifier, and Challenger before the much-anticipated final.

The opening match of MLC 2024 will feature MI New York and the Seattle Orcas. Both teams boast impressive lineups, with MI New York's Nicholas Pooran and Kieron Pollard going head-to-head with Seattle Orcas' Quinton de Kock and Shimron Hetmyer. This match is sure to set the tone for an exciting tournament.
